A) LHCC
B) 2026-02-05 07:57 C) 2026-02-19 23:59
E) MILITARY INVASION OF UKRAINE BY RUSSIAN FEDERATION
ONGOING MILITARY ACTIVITY IN UKRAINE AND THE AIRSPACE WITHIN 200NM
ALONG BORDER UKRAINE/RUSSIA IN THE MOSCOW FIR USE OF A WIDE RANGE OF
GROUND AND AIRBORNE WARFARE SYSTEMS WHICH POSE A HIGH RISK FOR
CIVIL FLIGHTS OPERATING AT ALL ALTITUDES AND FLIGHT LEVELS.
AIR CARRIERS HOLDING OPERATING LICENCE ISSUED BY HUNGARY - PILOTS IN
COMMAND OF ACFT CONDUCTING AIR SERVICES BY HUNGARIAN OPERATING
LICENCE HOLDERS AND OPERATORS OF HUNGARIAN REGISTERED ACFT
SHALL NOT ENTER FIR LVIV (UKLV), FIR KYIV (UKBV), UIR KYIV (UKBU),
FIR DNIPROPETROVSK (UKDV), FIR SIMFEROPOL (UKFV), FIR ODESA
(UKOV), FIR ROSTOV-NA-DONU (URRV). SAID OPERATORS AND AIRCRAFT
OWNERS SHALL ALSO AVOID FLIGHT OPERATIONS WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE
EXTENDING OUT TO 200NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS
WITHIN THE FIR CHISINAU (LUUU) AIRSPACE SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN
COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY
REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING
DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING IN FOLLOWING AIRSPACE:
MOSCOW (UUWV).

LPPP-A0388/26 NOTAM
Q) LPXX / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 3059N02416W999
A) LPPC LPPO
B) 2026-01-29 22:47 C) 2026-02-16 23:59
E) UNTIL 16 FEBRUARY 2026, PORTUGUESE CIVIL AIR OPERATORS ARE
STRONGLY ADVISED TO AVOID ALL FLIGHT OPERATIONS WITHIN THE MAIQUETIA
FIR (SVZM).
THIS RECOMMENDATION IS ISSUED DUE TO A HEIGHTENED RISK TO CIVIL
AVIATION RESULTING FROM THE INCREASINGLY UNPREDICTABLE OPERATING
ENVIRONMENT IN THE REGION, INCLUDING:
-INCREASED, SUDDEN AND UNCOORDINATED STATE AND MILITARY AIRCRAFT
ACTIVITY,
-THE DEPLOYMENT AND PRESENCE OF ADVANCED AIR-DEFENCE SYSTEMS CAPABLE
OF ENGAGING TARGETS AT ALL ALTITUDES,
-GNSS INTERFERENCE AND OTHER NAVIGATION DISRUPTIONS,
-POTENTIAL FOR MISIDENTIFICATION, SHORT-NOTICE AIRSPACE CHANGES AND
REDUCED DIVERSION OPTIONS IN PARTS OF THE REGION.
THESE CONDITIONS SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE OPERATIONAL UNCERTAINTY FOR
CIVIL AIRCRAFT OPERATING WITHIN OR TRANSITING THE AFFECTED AIRSPACE
AND MAY POSE A SERIOUS THREAT TO FLIGHT SAFETY.
PORTUGUESE CIVIL AIR OPERATORS ARE ALSO ADVISED TO EXERCISE CAUTION
AND IMPLEMENT CONTINGENCY PLANNING FOR OPERATIONS AND ROUTE PLANNING
WITHIN THE AIRSPACE OF FIR SAN JUAN (TJZS), FIR CURACAO (TNCF) AND
FIR PIARCO (TTZP) WEST OF 057W.
DUE TO POTENTIAL SPILLOVER RISKS RELATED TO THE DEPLOYMENT AND
POSSIBLE USE OF MILITARY ASSETS IN THE REGION, PORTUGUESE CIVIL AIR
OPERATORS SHOULD CLOSELY MONITOR AIRSPACE DEVELOPMENTS AND COMPLY
WITH ALL AVAILABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS RELEVANT TO THE AREA.
EMERGENCY PROVISIONS: IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY REQUIRING
IMMEDIATE ACTION TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF THE FLIGHT, THE
PILOT-IN-COMMAND IS AUTHORIZED TO DEVIATE FROM THIS ADVISORY AS
NECESSARY TO ADDRESS THE SITUATION.

IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL RULES AND REGULATIONS IS THE
HELLENIC CAA THROUGH THE HELLENIC ATS AND AIS UNITS.

ACTIVITIES ANNOUNCED BY REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0238/26 HAVE ALREADY
BEEN EXPRESSED IN THE REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A0136/26, WHICH IS THE ONLY
VALID AND EFFECTIVE WITHIN ATHINAI FIR, AND THEY REMAIN UNCHANGED.

HELLENIC CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY THROUGH ITS APPROPRIATE AIS UNIT.

PRODUCE ANY LEGAL EFFECT INTERNATIONALLY AS REGARDS ATHINAI FIR.

AIRCRAFT ARE STRONGLY ADVISED NOT TO FLY WITHIN THE AREA
DESIGNATED IN PARA (1) ABOVE.

BE AUTHORIZED TO ENTER THIS AREA AFTER SPECIAL PERMISSION
BY APPROPRIATE ATC UNIT.

LGGG-A0063/26 NOTAM
Q) LGGG / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 3704N02444E341
A) LGGG
B) 2026-01-11 21:00 C) 2026-02-11 20:59
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A4494/25 (311003 EUECYIYN DEC 2025).
REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0099/26 (090812 EUECYIYN JAN 2026).
WITH REFERENCE TO REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0099/26 WE POINT OUT THAT
THE ASSERTIONS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE REJECTED AS MISLEADING AND
DEVOID OF ANY LEGAL BASIS. IN THIS RESPECT AND FURTHER TO THE REF
(A) GREEK NOTAM A4494/25, PARA 2.2, WE REITERATE THAT GREECE,
ESTABLISHED IN 1931 IN ACCORDANCE WITH INTERNATIONAL LAW A
TERRITORIAL SEA OF TEN NAUTICAL MILES FOR THE PURPOSES OF AVIATION
AND THE CONTROL THEREOF.
THEREFORE, GREEK AIRSPACE DOES NOT EXCEED THE BREADTH OF THE
TERRITORIAL SEA AS ESTABLISHED IN 1931.
GREECE, THEREFORE,  FULLY ABIDES BY INTERNATIONAL LAW AND WILL
CONTINUE TO DO SO WHILE FULLY EXERCISING ITS SOVEREIGNTY. IN FACT, AS
FAR AS INTERNATIONAL LAW IS CONCERNED, TURKEY IS THE ONLY COUNTRY,
REGRETTABLY, WHICH ALSO FAILS TO RESPECT THE PROVISIONS OF THE
CHICAGO CONVENTION WITHIN THE ATHINAI FIR, WHERE, IN ACCORDANCE WITH
THE ICAO REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION AGREEMENTS OF 1950-1952-1958, THE
GREEK AUTHORITIES ARE THE ONLY COMPETENT AUTHORITIES CHARGED TO
IMPLEMENT THE RELEVANT PROVISIONS OF THE CHICAGO CONVENTION AND TO
ENSURE UNIMPEDED, REGULAR AND SAFE AIR TRAFFIC.
ALSO, REFERENCE IS MADE TO THE ABOVE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0099/26
IN ORDER TO STATE THAT THE ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY BETWEEN
POINTS 404500N0261000E AND 360500N0300000E HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED BY
ICAO REGIONAL AGREEMENTS (REACHED IN THE SECOND MIDDLE EAST REGIONAL
AIR NAVIGATION MEETING, ISTANBUL 1950 AND SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED  BY
THE ICAO COUNCIL ON 14 DEC 1950, DOC 7055 MID/2-RAC) WITH THE
PARTICIPATION AND APPROVAL OF TURKEY AND IN FEB 1958, (DOC 7870,
EUM/IV) AND CONSEQUENTLY IS FOUNDED ON THE FIRMEST POSSIBLE LEGAL
BASIS AS NOTED IN OUR A1709/07 LGGGYNYX NOTAM.
FURTHERMORE THE SAID ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY WAS DEPICTED ON
CHART NUMBER 7 ATTACHED TO THE REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION AGREEMENT
WHICH WAS REACHED IN THE THIRD REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATIONAL CONFERENCE
(PARIS 1952) AND SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED BY THE ICAO COUNCIL ON 23
JUNE 1952.
ACCORDINGLY, GREECE HAS BEEN ASIGNED RESPONSIBILITY FOR ALL ATM
SERVICES AND ICAO PURPOSES AS WELL AS FOR SAR  WITHIN
ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS UIR AND IS THE ONLY COMPETENT THEREIN.
FINALLY, THE ADDITIONAL PROVISION MENTIONED IN PARAGRAPH 2.3 OF
THE REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A4494/25 (311003 EUECYIYN DEC 2025) AIM AT
THE PROMOTION OF SAFETY, REGULARITY AND EFFICIENCY OF INTERNATIONAL
AIR NAVIGATION AND FOR UNMANNED AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION PURPOSES IN
CONFORMITY WITH ARTICLE 3 (D) OF THE ICAO CONVENTION ON INTERNATIONAL
CIVIL AVIATION AS AMPLIFIED BY THE A40-04 ICAO ASSEMBLY RESOLUTIONS,
APPENDIX I, RESOLVING  CLAUSE 2, SEE ALSO THE ANNEX 2, APPENDIX 4, TO
THE ICAO CONVENTION ON INTERNATIONAL CIVIL AVIATION AS WELL AS
ARTICLE 12 OF THE ICAO CONVENTION AND THE ESTABLISHED INTERNATIONAL
PRACTICE.
CONSEQUENTLY, THE POINTS RAISED BY TURKEY IN REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM
A0099/26 (090812 EUECYIYN JAN 2026), ARE IRRELEVANT AND THE SAID
NOTAM IS NULL AND VOID AND NOT APPLICABLE TO ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS
UIR. THE REQUIREMENTS EXPRESSED IN THE REF (A) GREEK NOTAM
A4494/25 ARE FULLY IN FORCE.

B) 2026-02-04 07:52 C) 2026-02-06 19:40
E) REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A0266/26 (031945 EUECYIYN FEB 2026).
REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0422/26 (040435 EUECYIYN FEB 2026).
NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
WITH REFERENCE TO THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0422/26 (040435 EUECYIYN
FEB 2026) THE FOLLOWING SHOULD BE UNDERLINED:
1.- THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0422/26 (040435 EUECYIYN FEB 2026) IS
NULL AND VOID SINCE IT REFERS TO SEARCH AND RESCUE ACTIVITIES WITHIN
ATHINAI FIR WHERE THE ONLY COMPETENT AUTHORITY TO PROMULGATE NOTAMS,
ACCORDING TO ICAO PROVISIONS, IS THE HELLENIC CIVIL AVIATION
AUTHORITY THROUGH ITS APPROPRIATE AIS UNIT.
2.- IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE SEARCH AND RESCUE REGION UNDER GREEK
RESPONSIBILITY COINCIDES WITH THE ATHINAI FIR, AS DECIDED DURING THE
ISTANBUL (1950), PARIS (1952) AND GENEVA (1958) REGIONAL AIR
NAVIGATION MEETINGS ACCEPTED BY THE PARTICIPANT STATES INCLUDING
TURKEY AND APPROVED BY UNANIMOUS ICAO COUNCIL DECISIONS. THIS IS ALSO
REGISTERED AND HAS BEEN CIRCULATED WITHIN IMO (SAR.8/CIRC.1/CORR.3,
ANNEX 2) AND IS CONSISTENT WITH IMO AND ICAO RECOMMENDATIONS ON THE
ALIGNMENT OF SEARCH AND RESCUE BOUNDARIES WITH THE CORRESPONDING FIR.
FURTHERMORE THE JRCC PIRAEUS IS THE ONLY COMPETENT AUTHORITY THAT
COORDINATES EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY ALL SAR OPERATIONS WITHIN THE
ENTIRE GREEK SAR REGION.
3.- FINALLY, THE AREA AS DESCRIBED IN REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A0266/26
(031945 EUECYIYN FEB 2026), LIES WITHIN GREEK TERRITORY, GREEK
TERRITORIAL WATERS AND GREEK NATIONAL AIRSPACE, WHERE GREECE
EXERCISES SOVEREIGNTY ACCORDING TO INTERNATIONAL LAW.
AS IN THE PAST, TURKISH AUTHORITIES' MISINTERPRETATION AND DISTORTION
OF THE LETTER AND SPIRIT OF INTERNATIONAL DOCUMENTS, CONCERNING
SEARCH AND RESCUE RESPONSIBILITIES, ARE REJECTED BY GREECE, AS THEY
MAY LEAD TO SERIOUS INSTITUTIONAL AND PRACTICAL COMPLICATIONS IN THE
CONDUCT OF SEARCH AND RESCUE OPERATIONS.
MOREOVER IT IS REITERATED THAT GREECE EFFECTIVELY PROVIDES SEARCH AND
RESCUE SERVICES WITHIN THE SEARCH AND RESCUE REGION UNDER ITS
RESPONSIBILITY, SINCE ITS CREATION.
FOR ALL THESE REASONS, THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0422/26 (040435
EUECYIYN FEB 2026) IS NULL AND VOID AND IS HEREBY REJECTED.
THE REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A0266/26 (031945 EUECYIYN FEB 2026) IS THE
ONLY VALID AND EFFECTIVE WITHIN ATHINAI FIR AND NO FURTHER
EXPLANATION WILL BE GIVEN.

NOTAMS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL RULES AND REGULATIONS IS

ACTIVITIES ANNOUNCED BY REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A5936/25 HAVE ALREADY
BEEN EXPRESSED IN THE REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A4491/25, WHICH IS THE ONLY
VALID AND EFFECTIVE WITHIN ATHINAI FIR, AND THEY REMAIN UNCHANGED.

2.1.- FLIGHT PLANS MUST BE SUBMITTED AND PERMISSION BY APPROPRIATE
ATC UNIT MUST BE OBTAINED.
2.2.- OUT OF TMAS, THE LIAISONS OF THE UNIT CONDUCTING THE ACTIVITIES
SHALL ESTABLISH CONTACT WITH ATHINAI CONTROL.
3.- PROCEDURES FOR NON EXERCISE AIRCRAFT:
3.1.- IN THE INTEREST OF SAFETY DURING ACTIVITIES, NON EXERCISE
AIRCRAFT ARE STRONGLY ADVISED NOT TO FLY WITHIN THE AREA
DESIGNATED IN PARA (1) ABOVE.
3.2- OTHER AIRCRAFT UNABLE TO AVOID THE ABOVE DESCRIBED AREA WILL BE
AUTHORIZED TO ENTER THIS AREA AFTER SPECIAL PERMISSION BY APPROPRIATE
ATC UNIT.

NOT ENTER UIR KYIV (UKBU), FIR LVIV (UKLV), FIR KYIV (UKBV), FIR

ROSTOV (URRV), FIR CHISINAU (LUUU) EXCEPT FOR THE PORTION OF

ISSUED BY REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA.

WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200NM ALONG THE
UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER.

TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING IN THE FOLLOWING AIRSPACE: MOSCOW (UUWV).

LTAA-A5936/25 NOTAM
Q) LTXX / QWELW / IV / BO / W / 000/100 / 3715N02613E014
A) LTBB LGGG
B) 2026-01-02 05:00 C) 2026-12-31 16:00
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:

1. TURKIYE REQUESTED THE GREEK AIS TO PROMULGATE APPROPRIATE NOTAM
FOR THE EXERCISE AREA LOCATED WITHIN INTERNATIONAL WATERS AND
AIRSPACE OF AEGEAN SEA REGARDING THE TURKISH NAVY AND AIRFORCE
FIRING MILITARY EXERCISE (ASFAO) TO BE CONDUCTED FROM 02 JAN TILL
31 DEC 2026 0500-1600UTC (EXCEPT SATURDAYS, SUNDAYS, HOLIDAYS) WITH
REF 250826 LTAAYNYX DEC 2025.
GREEK AIS DID NOT PROMULGATE APPROPRIATE NOTAM FOR THE EXERCISE
AREA IN ACCORDANCE WITH OUR REF 250826 DEC 2025. UNDER THESE
CIRCUMSTANCES DUE TO THE INSISTENT ATTITUDE OF GREECE, TURKIYE IS
LEFT WITH NO OTHER ALTERNATIVE BUT TO TAKE ITS OWN INITATIVE TO
PROMULGATE THE NECESSARY NOTAM FOR THE EXERCISE AREA.
TURKIYE WILL TAKE NECESSARY MEASURES FOR THE SAFETY OF THE GENERAL
AIR TRAFFIC AS SHE DID IN THE PAST AND IS ALWAYS READY FOR
COOPERATION AND COORDINATION IN THIS RESPECT.

2. THE NOTAM INFORMATION FOR THE EXERCISE AREA IS AS FOLLOWED.
TURKISH NAVY AND AIRFORCE SHALL MAKE 'ASFAO' EXERCISE IN
INTERNATIONAL WATERS AND AIRSPACE OF AEGEAN SEA AS DESCRIBED BELOW.

3. EXERCISE AREA:
A. LATERAL LIMITS:
AREA: 372700N0261700E 370830N0262730E 370500N0260900E
372400N0260000E 372400N0260400E 372700N0261700E
B. VERTICAL LIMITS: SFC-10000FT AMSL
C. DATE AND TIMES:
JAN 02 0500-1600
JAN 05-30 MON-FRI 0500-1600
FEB 02-MAR 18 MON-FRI 0500-1600
MAR 23-APR 22 MON-FRI 0500-1600
APR 24 0500-1600
APR 27-APR 30 0500-1600
MAY 04-15 MON-FRI 0500-1600
MAY 18 0500-1600
MAY 20-22 0500-1600
MAY 25 0500-1600

JUL 13 14 16 17 0500-1600
JUL 20-OCT 23 MON-FRI 0500-1600
OCT 26 27 30 0500-1600
NOV 02- DEC 31 MON-FRI 0500-1600

4. PROCEDURES FOR EXERCISE AIRCRAFT:
A. THE FLIGHTS WILL BE CONDUCTED UNDER VFR CONDITIONS AND UNDER THE
POSITIVE RADAR CONTROL.
B. EXERCISE AIRCRAFT SHALL DISPLAY ANTI/COLLISION AND NAVIGATION
LIGHTS CONTINUOUSLY.

5. PROCEDURES FOR NON-EXERCISE AIRCRAFT:
IN THE INTEREST OF FLYING SAFETY DURING THE EXERCISE NON-EXERCISE
AIRCRAFT ARE STRONGLY ADVISED NOT TO FLY WITHIN THE EXERCISE AREA
DESCRIBED ABOVE.

ACTIVITIES SHALL ESTABLISH CONTACT WITH ATHINAI CONTROL.

AIRCRAFT ARE STRONGLY ADVISED NOT TO FLY WITHIN THE AREAS
DESIGNATED IN PARAS (1) AND (2) ABOVE.

FURTHERMORE, THE ALLEGATIONS CONTAINED IN REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM
A0388/26 (021227 EUECYIYN FEB 2026) ARE ERRONEOUS, MISLEADING AND
DEVOID OF ANY LEGAL BASIS.
WITHIN THE FRAMEWORK OF ITS WELL KNOWN AND LONG STANDING POSITIONS,
WHICH ARE IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH INTERNATIONAL LAW, GREECE WILL
CONTINUE TO PLAN AND CONDUCT MILITARY EXERCISES IN THESE AREAS, AS
IT HAS REGULARLY BEEN DOING ALL ALONG.
CONSEQUENTLY, THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0388/26 (021227 EUECYIYN FEB
2026) IS NULL AND VOID AND NOT APPLICABLE WITHIN ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS
UIR.
THE ONLY VALID AND EFFECTIVE NOTAMS WITHIN ATHINAI FIR ARE THE ABOVE
REF (A) GREEK NOTAMS A0244/26 AND A0245/26 (020900 AND 020904
EUECYIYN FEB 2026) ISSUED BY GREECE.
FINALLY, THE HELLENIC AUTHORITIES CATEGORICALLY REJECT THE ATTEMPT
BY TURKEY TO INTRODUCE IN THE FLOW OF THE NOTAM ISSUING SYSTEM,
POLITICALLY MOTIVATED STATEMENTS OF POSITIONS, WHICH, BESIDES BEING
BASELESS, HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH THE FUNDAMENTAL PURPOSE OF THAT
SYSTEM, NAMELY THE SAFETY OF AIR NAVIGATION.
LIKEWISE, THE ABOVE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0388/26 USE FALSE NAMES TO
DESIGNATE THE SPECIFIC GREEK ISLANDS INSTEAD OF THEIR
INTERNATIONALLY KNOWN NAMES.

LGGG-A2109/15 NOTAM
Q) LGGG / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 3852N02444E999
A) LGGG
B) 2015-10-20 09:57 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A2086/15 LGGGYNYX.
REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A4814/15 LTAAYNYX (191430 EUECYIYN OCT 2015).
REFERENCE IS MADE TO THE ABOVE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A4814/15
LTAAYNYX IN ORDER TO STATE THAT THE ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY
BETWEEN POINTS 404500N0261000E AND 360500N0300000E HAS BEEN
ESTABLISHED BY ICAO REGIONAL AGREEMENTS WITH THE PARTICIPATION AND
APPROVAL OF TURKEY AND CONSEQUENTLY IS FOUNDED ON THE FIRMEST
POSSIBLE LEGAL BASIS AS NOTED IN OUR A1709/07 LGGGYNYX NOTAM.
MORE SPECIFICALLY THE REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION AGREEMENT REACHED IN
THE SECOND MIDDLE EAST REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION MEETING (ISTANBUL
1950) AGREED THAT THE ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY BETWEEN POINTS
404500N0261000E AND 360500N0300000E FOLLOWS THE WESTERN FRONTIER OF
TURKEY. THIS AGREEMENT WAS SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED  BY THE ICAO
COUNCIL ON 14 DEC 1950 (DOC 7055 MID/2-RAC).
FURTHERMORE THE SAID ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY WAS DEPICTED ON
CHART NUMBER 7 ATTACHED TO THE REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION AGREEMENT
WHICH WAS REACHED IN THE THIRD REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATIONAL CONFERENCE
(PARIS 1952) AND SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED BY THE ICAO COUNCIL ON 23
JUNE 1952.
CONSEQUENTLY, THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A4814/15 LTAAYNYX (191430
EUECYIYN OCT 2015) HAS NO GROUND, IS CONSIDERED NULL AND VOID AND
THUS CANNOT PRODUCE ANY LEGAL EFFECT.
THE ONLY VALID AND EFFECTIVE NOTAM WITHIN ATHINAI FIR IS REF (A)
A2086/15 LGGGYNYX, ISSUED BY GREECE.

LEAN-B8778/25 NOTAM
Q) LEXX / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 4219N00344W433
A) LECM LECB
B) 2025-11-13 15:51 C) 2026-02-16 23:00
E) IN ACCORDANCE WITH COUNCIL DECISION (CFSP) 2021/908 , PERMISSION
TO LAND IN, TAKE-OFF FROM OR OVERFLY THE TERRITORY OF SPAIN SHALL
BE DENIED TO ANY AIRCRAFT OPERATED BY BELARUSIAN AIR CARRIERS,
INCLUDING AS A MARKETING CARRIER IN CODE-SHARING OR BLOCKED-SPACE
ARRANGEMENTS.

PREVIOUS PARAGRAPH SHALL NOT APPLY IN THE CASE OF AN EMERGENCY
LANDING OR AN EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT. SPANISH AUTHORITIES MAY
DETERMINE NOT APPLICABILITY OF THE PARAGRAPH ABOVE WHEN A
LANDING, TAKE-OFF OR OVERFLIGHT IS REQUIRED FOR HUMANITARIAN
PURPOSES OR ANY OTHER PURPOSES.

LGGG-A0136/26 NOTAM
Q) LGGG / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 3704N02444E341
A) LGGG
B) 2026-01-23 18:00 C) 2026-02-24 17:00
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
REF (A) TURKISH NOTAM A0238/26 (200726 EUECYIYN JAN 2026), TURKISH
NOTAM REQUEST MESSAGE 250700 LTAAYNYX DEC 2025.
REF (B) GREEK COORDINATION MESSAGE 151120 LGACYAYC JAN 2026.
THIS NOTAM IS ISSUED TO STATE THAT THE REF (A) TURKISH NOTAM
A0238/26 (200726 EUECYIYN JAN 2026) IS NULL AND VOID SINCE IT REFERS
TO TURKISH ACTIVITIES WITHIN ATHINAI FIR, WHERE THE ONLY COMPETENT
AUTHORITY TO PROMULGATE NOTAMS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO RULES AND
REGULATIONS IS THE HELLENIC CAA THROUGH ITS APPROPRIATE AIS UNIT AND
THE ONLY RESPONSIBLE AUTHORITY FOR THE SAFETY OF THE AIR TRAFFIC IS
THE HELLENIC CAA THROUGH THE ATS UNITS.
GREECE'S REFUSAL TO PROMULGATE A NOTAM FOLLOWING THE TURKISH REQUEST
IS DUE TO THE FACT THAT TURKEY INSISTS TO SUBMITTING REQUESTS THAT
ARE NOT IN LINE WITH ICAO RULES, REGULATIONS AND RECOMMENDATIONS AS
WELL AS WITH INTERNATIONAL LAW AND ALSO REFUSES TO COORDINATE WITH
THE ONLY COMPETENT AUTHORITY WITHIN ATHINAI FIR, THE HCAA.
AS IT HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY NOTED IN THE PAST AND WITH THE REF (B)
151120 LGACYAYC JAN 2026 GREEK COORDINATION MESSAGE, WHICH WAS
IGNORED BY TURKEY, PARTS OF THE AREA MENTIONED IN TURKISH NOTAM
A0238/26 (200726 EUECYIYN JAN 2026) OVERLAP AREAS OF NATIONAL
SOVEREIGNTY OF GREECE.
ADDITIONALLY, SEARCH AND RESCUE REGION UNDER GREEK RESPONSIBILITY
COINCIDES WITH ATHINAI FIR, AS MENTIONED IN GREEK COORDINATION
MESSAGE 151120 LGACYAYC JAN 2026, THROUGH THE JRCC PIRAEUS WHICH IS
THE ONLY COMPETENT AUTHORITY TO COORDINATE SAR SUPPORT MISSION
ACTIVITIES, AS REFERRED TO IN THE TURKISH NOTAM REQUEST MESSAGE
250700 LTAAYNYX DEC 2025.
MOREOVER, TURKEY, IGNORING HCAA'S COORDINATION MESSAGE, NOT ONLY
DISREGARDS THE SAFETY OF THE GENERAL AIR TRAFFIC WITHIN ATHINAI FIR
BUT ALSO CAUSES DISRUPTION TO THE CIVIL AVIATION BY REQUESTING
LONG-TERM RESERVATION OF AIRSPACE AND BY BLOCKING MOST ECONOMIC
FLIGHT LEVELS, THUS COMPROMISING EFFICIENCY AND REGULARITY OF
INTERNATIONAL CIVIL AVIATION TRAFFIC.
CONSEQUENTLY, THE AREAS AS REQUESTED ARE NOT AVAILABLE.
FOR THE ABOVE MENTIONED REASONS THE TURKISH NOTAM A0238/26 (200726
EUECYIYN JAN 2026) IS NULL AND VOID AND NOT APPLICABLE TO ATHINAI FIR
.

MILITARY INVASION OF UKRAINE BY RUSSIAN FEDERATION.
CROATIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN CROATIA
SHALL NOT ENTER UIR KYIV (UKBU), FIR LVIV (UKLV), FIR KYIV (UKBV),
FIR DNIPROPETROVSK (UKDV), FIR SIMFEROPOL (UKFV), FIR ODESA (UKOV),
FIR ROSTOV-ON-DON (URRV).
SAID OPERATORS AND AIRCRAFT OWNERS SHALL ALSO AVOID FLIGHT
OPERATIONS WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200NM ALONG THE
UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN THE FIR CHISINAU (LUUU)
AIRSPACE SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE
AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA.
OPERATORS ARE REMINDED THAT OPERATIONS WITHIN FIR MINSK (UMMV) ARE
PROHIBITED IN ACCORDANCE WITH EASA SAFETY DIRECTIVES SD-2021-02 AND
SD-2021-03.
ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE
TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING IN THE FOLLOWING AIRSPACE: MOSCOW (UUWV).

2025) OVERLAP AREAS OF NATIONAL SOVEREIGNTY OF GREECE.

EUECYIYN DEC 2025) IS NULL AND VOID AND NOT APPLICABLE TO ATHINAI FIR

ALL AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED
BY CITIZENS OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AND ALL OPERATORS HOLDING
AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION
AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY SPANISH
AIRSPACE EXCEPT HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY
RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE SPANISH
AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY
OVERFLIGHT. REQUESTS FOR HUMANITARIAN FLIGHTS SHALL BE SENT TO
THE CONCERNED SPANISH AIRPORT OPERATOR.

LGGG-A0253/26 NOTAM
Q) LGGG / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 3704N02444E341
A) LGGG
B) 2026-02-09 11:00 C) 2026-02-09 13:00
E) REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A0242/26 (020828 EUECYIYN FEB 2026)
REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0385/26 (021028 EUECYIYN FEB 2026).
NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
THIS NOTAM IS ISSUED TO STATE THAT THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM
A0385/26 (021028 EUECYIYN FEB 2026) IS NULL AND VOID SINCE IT REFERS
TO ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS UIR, WHERE THE ONLY COMPETENT AUTHORITY TO
PROMULGATE NOTAMS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO RULES AND REGULATIONS IS
THE HELLENIC CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY THROUGH ITS APPROPRIATE AIS
UNIT.
FURTHERMORE, THE ALLEGATIONS CONTAINED IN REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM
A0385/26 (021028 EUECYIYN FEB 2026) ARE ERRONEOUS, MISLEADING AND
DEVOID OF ANY LEGAL BASIS.
WITHIN THE FRAMEWORK OF ITS WELL KNOWN AND LONG STANDING POSITIONS,
WHICH ARE IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH INTERNATIONAL LAW, GREECE WILL
CONTINUE TO PLAN AND CONDUCT MILITARY EXERCISES IN THIS AREA, AS
IT HAS REGULARLY BEEN DOING ALL ALONG.
CONSEQUENTLY, THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0385/26 (021028 EUECYIYN FEB
2026) IS NULL AND VOID AND NOT APPLICABLE WITHIN ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS
UIR.
THE ONLY VALID AND EFFECTIVE NOTAM WITHIN ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS UIR IS
THE ABOVE REF (A) A0242/26 ISSUED BY GREECE.
FINALLY, THE HELLENIC AUTHORITIES CATEGORICALLY REJECT THE ATTEMPT
BY TURKEY TO INTRODUCE IN THE FLOW OF THE NOTAM ISSUING SYSTEM,
POLITICALLY MOTIVATED STATEMENTS OF POSITIONS, WHICH, BESIDES BEING
BASELESS, HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH THE FUNDAMENTAL PURPOSE OF THAT
SYSTEM, NAMELY THE SAFETY OF AIR NAVIGATION.
LIKEWISE, THE ABOVE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0385/26 USES FALSE NAME TO
DESIGNATE THE SPECIFIC GREEK ISLAND INSTEAD OF ITS
INTERNATIONALLY KNOWN NAME.

A) LTBB LGGG
B) 2026-02-09 06:00 C) 2026-02-26 10:00
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNS:

THIS NOTAM IS ISSUED TO CLARIFY THE 'A0244/26' AND 'A0245/26'
LGGGYNYX NOTAM ISSUED BY GREEK CAA.
THE 'A0244/26' AND 'A0245/26' NOTAM ISSUED BY GREEK CAA CONSTITUES A
BREACH OF GREECE'S TREATY OBLIGATIONS PERTAINING TO THE
DEMILITARIZED STATUS OF EASTERN AEGEAN ISLANDS UNDER 'THE 1914 SIX
POWERS' DECISION', 'THE 1923 LAUSANNE PEACE TREATY (WITH ITS ANNEX,
THE CONVENTION RELATING TO THE REGIME OF THE STRAITS)' AND  'THE
1947 PARIS PEACE TREATY'. LIMNI (LEMNOS), BOZBABA (AYA EVSTRATIOS),
MIDILLI (MITYELENE), SAKIZ (CHIOS), SISAM (SAMOS), ILEKI (TILOS) AND
HERKE (CALKI) MENTIONED IN THE NOTAM AT REFERENCE HAS A
DEMILITARIZED STATUS. THUS CONVENTION RELATING TO 'THE REGIME OF THE
STRAITS' AND 'THE 1947 PARIS PEACE TREATY'. LIMNI (LEMNOS),
BOZBABA(AYA EVSTRATIOS), MIDILLI (MITYELENE), SAKIZ (CHIOS), SISAM
(SAMOS), ILEKI (TILOS) AND HERKE (CALKI) AND/OR HER TERRITORY MUST
NOT BE INCLUDED IN ANY SCENERIO/CONCEPT OF ANY MILITARY TRAINING OR
EXERCISE.

LTAA-A0422/26 NOTAM
Q) LTXX / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 3821N02558E357
A) LTBB LGGG
B) 2026-02-04 04:25 C) 2026-02-06 19:40
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
THIS NOTAM IS ISSUED TO CLARIFY THE 'A0266/26' LGGG NOTAM ISSUED BY
GREEK CAA.
AS REGARDS THE GREEK NOTAM 'A0266/26' LGGG, TURKIYE DOES NOT ACCEPT
THE DEFINITION OF THE SEARCH AND RESCUE (SAR) AREA WITH REFERENCE TO
ATHENS FIR. THE AREA REFERRED TO IN THE SAID GREEK NOTAM VIOLATES
PART OF TURKISH TERRITORIAL WATERS AND PARTLY FALLS WITHIN TURKIYE'S
MARITIME SEARCH AND RESCUE REGION (SRR) AS DECLARED TO THE IMO AND
INCLUDED IN THE IMO'S GLOBAL SAR PLAN. THEREFORE, ALL SAR
EFFORTS/ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE TURKISH SRR MUST BE COORDINATED WITH
THE RELEVANT TURKISH AUTHORITIES.

LGGG-A0274/26 NOTAM
Q) LGGG / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 3704N02444E341
A) LGGG
B) 2026-02-04 12:54 C) 2026-02-06 19:40
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A0267/26 (040753 EUECYIYN FEB 2026).
REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0437/26 (041040 EUECYIYN FEB 2026).
REFERENCE IS MADE TO THE ABOVE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0437/26 (041040
EUECYIYN FEB 2026) IN ORDER TO STATE THAT THE ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR
BOUNDARY BETWEEN POINTS 404500N 0261000E AND 360500N 0300000E HAS
BEEN ESTABLISHED BY ICAO REGIONAL AGREEMENTS WITH THE PARTICIPATION
AND APPROVAL OF TURKEY AND CONSEQUENTLY IS FOUNDED ON THE FIRMEST
POSSIBLE LEGAL BASIS AS NOTED IN OUR A1709/07 LGGGYNYX NOTAM.
MORE SPECIFICALLY, THE REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION AGREEMENT REACHED IN
THE SECOND MIDDLE EAST REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION MEETING (ISTANBUL
1950) AGREED THAT THE ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY BETWEEN POINTS
404500N 0261000E AND 360500N 0300000E FOLLOWS THE WESTERN FRONTIER OF
TURKEY. THIS AGREEMENT WAS SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED  BY THE ICAO COUNCIL
ON 14 DEC 1950 (DOC 7055 MID/2-RAC) AND IN FEB 1958 (DOC 7870,
EUM/IV).
FURTHERMORE, THE SAID ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY WAS DEPICTED ON
CHART NUMBER 7 ATTACHED TO THE REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION AGREEMENT
WHICH WAS REACHED IN THE THIRD REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATIONAL CONFERENCE
(PARIS 1952) AND SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED BY THE ICAO COUNCIL ON 23 JUNE
1952.
ACCORDINGLY, GREECE HAS BEEN ASSIGNED RESPONSIBILITY FOR ALL ATM
SERVICES AND ICAO PURPOSES AS WELL AS FOR SAR OPERATIONS WITHIN
ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS UIR, AS IS CLEARLY DEPICTED IN THE ICAO
AERONAUTICAL CHARTS, AND IS THE ONLY COMPETENT THEREIN NOT LEAVING
SPACE FOR MISLEADING OR MISINTERPRETATIONS.
CONSEQUENTLY, THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A0437/26 (041040 EUECYIYN FEB
2026) HAS NO GROUND, CANNOT PRODUCE ANY INTERNATIONALLY LEGAL EFFECT
WITHIN ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS UIR AND IS CONSIDERED NULL AND VOID.
THE ONLY VALID AND EFFECTIVE NOTAM WITHIN ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS UIR IS
THE REF (A) A0267/26 ISSUED BY GREECE.

ORIGINAL TURKISH NOTAM REQUEST.

THE NOTAM 'A4494/25' ITEM 2.2: 'UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SHALL NOT AFFECT
HELLENIC NATIONAL AIRSPACE LESS THAN 10NM ACCORDING TO AIP-GREECE,
ENR 1.1-1, PARA 1.1.1.2.1' AND ITEM 2.3: 'FLIGHT PLANS SHALL BE
SUBMITTED ACCORDING TO ICAO ANNEX 2, APPENDIX 4, PARA 1.6 AND
ACCORDING TO AIP-GREECE, ENR 1.10 AND GEN 1.7-1.' ARE IRRELEVANT
AND NOT CONTAINED IN THE ORIGINAL NOTAM REQUEST MADE BY TURKIYE.
FURTHERMORE THOSE STATEMENTS ARE IN CONTRAVENTION WITH ICAO RULES,
CONTRADICT WITH THE INTERNATIONAL LAW AND CONSEQUENTLY VIOLATE THE
RIGHT OF FREE USE OF INTERNATIONAL AIRSPACE.

IT'S UNPRECEDENTED AND DEFIANT PRACTICE OF GREECE DEFINING 6NM WIDE
TERRITORIAL WATERS AND 10NM NATIONAL AIRSPACE. ACCORDING TO
INTERNATIONAL LAW THE AIRSPACE OVER WHICH A STATE CAN CLAIM
COMPETENCE AND EXCLUSIVE SOVEREIGNTY IS LIMITED TO THAT PORTION
WHICH LIES ABOVE ITS TERRITORY AND THE TERRITORIAL WATERS ADJACENT
TO IT.

TURKIYE REGRETFULLY DENIES AND DOES NOT ACCEPT THE ILLEGAL CLAIMS OF
GREECE AND ITS MISUSE OF FIR RESPONSIBILITIES IN ORDER TO DEFEND ITS
OWN UNBASED NATIONAL POSITION. TURKISH NAVY UNMANNED ACFTS WILL
CONTINUE TO CONDUCT THEIR FLIGHTS RESPECTING THE 6NM GREEK AIRSPACE
AND WITHOUT SUBMITTING ANY FLIGHT PLAN AS BEING MILITARY AIRCRAFT
WHICH IS NOT SUBJECT TO 1944 CONVENTION ON INTERNATIONAL CIVIL
AVIATION. TURKIYE WILL TAKE ALL NECESSSARY MEASURES FOR THE SAFETY
OF THE GENERAL AIR TRAFFIC AND STAND BY FOR COOPERATION AND
COORDINATION.

EETN-A3914/25 NOTAM
Q) EETT / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 5848N02425E999
A) EETT
B) 2025-11-27 10:35 C) 2026-02-27 12:00
E) MILITARY INVASION OF UKRAINE BY RUSSIAN FEDERATION. ESTONIAN AIR
OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN ESTONIA SHALL NOT
ENTER UIR KYIV (UKBU), FIR LVIV (UKLV), FIR KYIV(UKBV),FIR
DNIPROPETROVSK (UKDV), FIR SIMFEROPOL (UKFV), FIR ODESA(UKOV),FIR
ROSTOV (URRV). SAID OPERATORS AND AIRCRAFT OWNERS SHALL ALSO AVOID
FLIGHT OPERATIONS WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200NM ALONG
THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN THE FIR CHISINAU (LUUU)
AIRSPACE SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE
AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL
RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE
OPERATING IN THE FOLLOWING AIRSPACE: MOSCOW (UUWV).

ACTIVITIES SHALL ESTABLISH CONTACT WITH ATHINAI CONTROL.
3.- PROCEDURES FOR NON EXERCISE AIRCRAFT:
3.1.- IN THE INTEREST OF SAFETY DURING ACTIVITIES, NON EXERCISE
AIRCRAFT ARE STRONGLY ADVISED NOT TO FLY WITHIN THE AREA
DESIGNATED IN PARA (1) ABOVE.
3.2- OTHER AIRCRAFT UNABLE TO AVOID THE ABOVE DESCRIBED AREA WILL
BE AUTHORIZED TO ENTER THIS AREA AFTER SPECIAL PERMISSION
BY APPROPRIATE ATC UNIT.

E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:

1. TURKIYE REQUESTED THE GREEK AIS TO PROMULGATE APPROPRIATE NOTAM
FOR THE EXERCISE AREAS LOCATED IN INTERNATIONAL WATERS WITHIN
ATHINAI FIR REGARDING TURKISH NAVY SHALL MAKE 'ENVIRONMENTAL
PROTECTION AND SAR SUPPORT MISSION' FLIGHTS WITHIN THE AIRSPACE OF
AEGEAN SEA AND EAST MEDITERRANEAN BETWEEN JAN 23 2026 - FEB 24 2026
WITH REF 250700 LTAAYNYX DEC 2025.
GREEK AIS DID NOT PROMULGATE APPROPRIATE NOTAM FOR THE EXERCISE
AREAS IN ACCORDANCE WITH OUR MESSAGE 250700 LTAAYNYX DEC 2025.
UNDER THESE CIRCUMSTANCES DUE TO THE INSISTENT ATTITUDE OF GREECE,
TURKIYE IS LEFT WITH NO OTHER ALTERNATIVE BUT TO TAKE ITS OWN
INITATIVE TO PROMULGATE THE NECESSARY NOTAM FOR THE EXERCISE AREAS.
TURKIYE WILL TAKE NECESSARY MEASURES FOR THE SAFETY OF THE GENERAL
AIR TRAFFIC AS SHE DID IN THE PAST AND IS ALWAYS READY FOR
COOPERATION AND COORDINATION IN THIS RESPECT.

2. THE NOTAM INFORMATION FOR THE EXERCISE AREAS ARE AS FOLLOWED.
TURKISH NAVY SHALL MAKE 'ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND SAR SUPPORT
MISSION' FLIGHT IN INTERNATIONAL WATERS WITHIN ATHINAI FIR AS
DESCRIBED BELOW:

LIIA-E1428/25 NOTAM
Q) LIXX / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/188 / 4118N01320E999
A) LIBB LIMM LIRR
B) 2025-06-13 17:27 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) FIREFIGHTING ACTIVITY IS REGULATED AS FLW:
-AIRCRAFT NOT INVOLVED IN FIREFIGHTING OPERATIONS MUST NOT
FLY OVER THE FIRE AREA AND MUST EXERCISE EXTREME CAUTION
WHEN FLYING NEAR IT, CONSIDERING THE POSSIBLE INTERVENTION
OF FIREFIGHTING ACFT.
THEREFORE, WHEN AN AERIAL FIREFIGHTING OPERATION IS
ANNOUNCED/ACTIVE, IT IS PROHIBITED TO FLY IN THE ZONES IDENTIFIED
BY THE FIRE-FIGHTING AUTHORITIES AND NOTIFIED BY THE COMPETENT
AUTHORITY OR, IN THE ABSENCE OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
I. WITHIN CONTROLLED AIRSPACE, IN THE ABSENCE OF SPECIFIC
COMMUNICATIONS ABOUT THE AREA AFFECTED BY THE FIREFIGHTING
OPERATIONS FROM THE ENGAGED ACFT, BELOW 760M (2500FT) AGL
WITHIN AN AREA EXTENDING UP TO A HORIZONTAL DISTANCE OF 4KM
(2 NM) FROM THE FIRE
II. OUTSIDE CONTROLLED AIRSPACE, BELOW 900M (3000FT) AGL,
WITHIN AN AREA EXTENDING UP TO A HORIZONTAL DISTANCE OF 9KM
(5NM) FROM THE FIRE.
-TIMELY UPDATES REGARDING THE ZONES AND AREAS AFFECTED
CAN BE BROADCAST ON GROUND/AIR/GROUND FREQUENCIES.
-THE ENGAGED FIREFIGHTING AIRCRAFT KEEP THE ATS UNIT
RESPONSIBLE FOR THE AFFECTED AREA INFORMED ABOUT THE
FIREFIGHTING OPERATIONS AND THEIR CONCLUSION.
-THE ATS UNIT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE AREA AFFECTED BY THE
FIREFIGHTING OPERATIONS PROVIDES AIR TRAFFIC SERVICES, AS FAR
AS POSSIBLE:
1.TO THE AIRCRAFT ENGAGED IN FIREFIGHTING OPERATIONS, EXCEPT
IN THE FIREFIGHTING AREA WHERE IT PROVIDES ONLY FLIGHT INFORMATION
AND ALERT SERVICES.
RMK: IF A CTR IS AFFECTED BY THE FIRE, SID/STAR/INSTR APCH PROC COULD
BE TEMPORARILY SUSPENDED OR MODIFIED
2.TO OTHER GAT FLIGHTS, BASED ON THE INFORMATION AVAILABLE REGARDING

THE HELLENIC CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY HEREBY DIRECTS THAT GREEK AIR
CARRIERS AND CAPTAINS OF ACFT IN CHARGE OF AIR SERVICES MANAGED
BY CARRIERS/HOLDERS OF AN OPERATING LICENCE ISSUED BY GREECE,
WHETHER THEY ARE CONTRACTUAL CARRIERS AND/OR DE FACTO CARRIERS OR
PERFORMING AIR SERVICES WITH A COMMERCIAL CHARTER AGREEMENT OR WITH
A CODE SHARING AGREEMENT AND TO ALL FLT PERFORMED WITH A GREEK
REGISTERED ACFT, SHALL NOT CONDUCT OPS IN FIR MINSK
(UMMV), UNLESS THE USE OF THAT AIRSPACE IS DEEMED NECESSARY TO
ENSURE SAFE OPERATION IN CASE OF UNFORESEEN CIRCUMSTANCES.
FOREIGN AIR CARRIERS INBOUND TO THE EU ARE RECOMMENDED TO AVOID
BELARUS MINSK FIR (UMMV). FOR MORE INFO SEE EASA SAFETY DIRECTIVE
SD2021-02.

A) LGGG
B) 2026-01-02 05:00 C) 2026-12-31 16:00
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
REF (A) TURKISH NOTAM A5936/25 (301103 EUECYIYN DEC 2025).
AND TURKISH NOTAM REQUEST MESSAGE 250826 LTAAYNYX DEC 2025.
REF (B) GREEK COORDINATION MESSAGE 291225 LGACYAYC DEC 2025.
THIS NOTAM IS ISSUED TO STATE THAT THE REF (A) TURKISH NOTAM
A5936/25 (301103 EUECYIYN DEC 2025) IS NULL AND VOID SINCE IT REFERS
TO TURKISH MILITARY ACTIVITIES WITHIN ATHINAI FIR, WHERE THE ONLY
COMPETENT AUTHORITY TO PROMULGATE NOTAMS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO
RULES AND REGULATIONS IS THE HELLENIC CAA THROUGH ITS APPROPRIATE
AIS UNIT AND THE ONLY RESPONSIBLE AUTHORITY FOR THE SAFETY OF THE
AIR TRAFFIC IN THE AREA IS THE HELLENIC CAA THROUGH THE ATS UNITS.
AS HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY NOTED IN THE PAST AND WITH THE REF (B)
291225 LGACYAYC DEC 2025 GREEK COORDINATION MESSAGE TO TURKEY, PARTS
OF THE AREA MENTIONED IN TURKISH NOTAM A5936/25 (301103 EUECYIYN DEC
2025) OVERLAP AREAS OF NATIONAL SOVEREIGNTY OF GREECE.
FURTHERMORE, THE TURKISH REQUEST ENTAILS LONG-TERM RESERVATION
OF AIRSPACE CONTRARY TO THE RELEVANT ICAO RECOMMENDATIONS.
MOREOVER THE REQUESTED EXERSICE AREA AFFECTS PART OF R19 AND L995
INTERNATIONAL AIRWAYS AS WELL AS DOMESTIC AIR TRAFFIC.
CONSEQUENTLY, THE AREA AS REQUESTED IS NOT AVAILABLE.
FOR THE ABOVE MENTIONED REASONS THE TURKISH NOTAM A5936/25 (301103
EUECYIYN DEC 2025) IS NULL AND VOID AND NOT APPLICABLE TO ATHINAI FIR
.

THE 'A0242/26' NOTAM ISSUED BY GREEK CAA CONSTITUES A BREACH OF
GREECE'S TREATY OBLIGATIONS PERTAINING TO THE DEMILITARIZED STATUS
OF EASTERN AEGEAN ISLANDS UNDER 'THE 1947 PARIS PEACE TREATY' KERPE
(SCARPANTO) MENTIONED IN THE NOTAM AT REFERENCE HAS A DEMILITARIZED
STATUS. THUS KERPE (SCARPANTO) AND/OR HER TERRITORY MUST NOT BE
INCLUDED IN ANY SCENERIO/CONCEPT OF ANY MILITARY TRAINING OR
EXERCISE.

LGGG-A0582/19 NOTAM
Q) LGGG / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 3704N02444E341
A) LGGG
B) 2019-02-20 09:07 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
REF (A) GREEK NOTAMS A1709/07 AND A1716/07 LGGGYNYX.
REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A1058/19 (181345 EUECYIYN FEB 2019).
THE LEGAL FACTS AS WELL AS THE LEGAL REQUIREMENTS SET IN THE REF (A)
GREEK NOTAMS ARE BASED ON ICAO REGIONAL AGREEMENTS APPROVED BY THE
ICAO COUNCIL AND ACCEPTED BY GREECE AND TURKEY.
MORE SPECIFICALLY THE REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION AGREEMENT REACHED IN
THE SECOND MIDDLE EAST REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION MEETING (ISTANBUL
1950) AGREED THAT THE ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY BETWEEN POINTS
404500N0261000E AND 360500N0300000E COINCIDES WITH THE WESTERN
FRONTIER OF TURKEY.THIS AGREEMENT WAS SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED BY THE
ICAO COUNCIL ON 14 DEC 1950 (DOC 7055 MID/2-RAC).
FURTHERMORE THE SAID ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY WAS DEPICTED ON
CHART NUMBER 7 ATTACHED TO THE REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATION AGREEMENT
WHICH WAS REACHED IN THE THIRD REGIONAL AIR NAVIGATIONAL CONFERENCE
(PARIS 1952) AND SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED BY THE ICAO COUNCIL ON 23
JUNE 1952. CONSEQUENTLY THE ATHINAI/ISTANBUL FIR BOUNDARY BETWEEN
THE ABOVE MENTIONED POINTS IS FOUNDED ON THE FIRMEST LEGAL BASIS
SINCE IT HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED BY INTERNATIONAL AGREEMENTS REACHED
IN THE FRAMEWORK OF ICAO AND ACCEPTED BY GREECE AND TURKEY.
CONSEQUENTLY THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A1058/19 LTAAYNYX (181345
EUECYIYN FEB 2019) HAS NO GROUND, CANNOT PRODUCE ANY INTERNATIONALLY
LEGAL EFFECT WITHIN ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS UIR AND IS CONSIDERED NULL
AND VOID.
THE ONLY VALID AND EFFECTIVE NOTAMS WITHIN ATHINAI FIR/ HELLAS UIR
ARE THE REF (A) GREEK NOTAMS A1709/07 AND A1716/07 LGGGYNYX.

NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:
THIS NOTAM IS ISSUED TO STATE THAT THE REF (B) TURKISH NOTAMS
A5952/25 AND A5937/24 LTAAYNYX (310952 AND 301123 EUECYIYN DEC 2025)
ARE NULL AND VOID SINCE THEY REFER TO TURKISH MILITARY ACTIVITIES
WITHIN ATHINAI FIR, WHERE THE ONLY COMPETENT AUTHORITY TO PROMULGATE
NOTAMS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL RULES AND REGULATIONS IS
THE HELLENIC CAA THROUGH THE HELLENIC ATS AND AIS UNITS.
FURTHERMORE THE HELLENIC POSITIONS REGARDING THE SAID MILITARY
ACTIVITIES ANNOUNCED BY REF (B) TURKISH NOTAM A5937/25 HAVE ALREADY
BEEN EXPRESSED IN THE REF (A) GREEK NOTAM A4492/25, WHICH IS THE
ONLY VALID AND EFFECTIVE WITHIN ATHINAI FIR, AND THEY REMAIN
UNCHANGED.

E) UKRAINIAN CRISIS:
IT SHALL BE PROHIBITED FOR ANY ACFT OPERATED BY RUSSIAN AIR
CARRIERS, OR FOR ANY RUSSIAN REGISTERED ACFT, OR FOR ANY NON-
RUSSIAN-REGISTERED ACFT WHICH IS OWNED OR CHARTERED, OR OTHERWISE
CONTROLLED BY ANY RUSSIAN NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSON, ENTITY OR BODY,
TO LAND IN, TAKE-OFF FROM OR OVERFLY THE TERRITORY OF THE REPUBLIC
OF BULGARIA.
THE PROHIBITITION SHALL NOT APPLY IN THE CASE OF AN EMERGENCY
LANDING OR AN EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT AND TO ACFT THAT HAVE A MAXIMUM
SEATING CAPACITY OF 4 PERSONS AND A MAXIMUM TAKE-OFF MASS OF NO MORE
THAN 2000KG WHEN USED FOR PRIVATE, NON-CORPORATE, FLIGHTS FOR
RECREATIONAL PURPOSES OR FOR THE PURPOSE OF TRAINING FOR PRIVATE
PILOT LICENSES AND RELATED RATINGS WITH UNION TRAINING PROVIDERS.

Q) LTXX / QWELW / IV / BO / W / 000/060 / 3906N02454E014
A) LTBB LGGG
B) 2026-01-02 05:00 C) 2026-12-31 16:00
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:

1. TURKIYE REQUESTED THE GREEK AIS TO PROMULGATE APPROPRIATE NOTAM
FOR THE EXERCISE AREA LOCATED WITHIN INTERNATIONAL WATERS AND
AIRSPACE OF AEGEAN SEA REGARDING THE TURKISH NAVY AND AIRFORCE
FIRING MILITARY EXERCISE (ASFAO) TO BE CONDUCTED FROM 02 JAN TILL
31 DEC 2026 0500-1600UTC (EXCEPT SATURDAYS, SUNDAYS, HOLIDAYS) WITH
REF 250829 LTAAYNYX DEC 2025.
GREEK AIS DID NOT PROMULGATE APPROPRIATE NOTAM FOR THE EXERCISE
AREA IN ACCORDANCE WITH OUR REF 250829 DEC 2025. UNDER THESE
CIRCUMSTANCES DUE TO THE INSISTENT ATTITUDE OF GREECE, TURKIYE IS
LEFT WITH NO OTHER ALTERNATIVE BUT TO TAKE ITS OWN INITATIVE TO
PROMULGATE THE NECESSARY NOTAM FOR THE EXERCISE AREA.
TURKIYE WILL TAKE NECESSARY MEASURES FOR THE SAFETY OF THE GENERAL
AIR TRAFFIC AS SHE DID IN THE PAST AND IS ALWAYS READY FOR
COOPERATION AND COORDINATION IN THIS RESPECT.

2. THE NOTAM INFORMATION FOR THE EXERCISE AREA IS AS FOLLOWED.
TURKISH NAVY AND AIRFORCE SHALL MAKE 'ASFAO' EXERCISE IN
INTERNATIONAL WATERS AND AIRSPACE OF AEGEAN SEA AS DESCRIBED BELOW.

3. EXERCISE AREA:
A. LATERAL LIMITS:
AREA: 390000N0251000E 392000N0245800E 391400N0244000E
385400N0245200E 390000N0251000E
B. VERTICAL LIMITS: SFC-6000FT AMSL
C. DATE AND TIMES:
JAN 02 0500-1600
JAN 05-30 MON-FRI 0500-1600
FEB 02-MAR 18 MON-FRI 0500-1600
MAR 23-APR 22 MON-FRI 0500-1600
APR 24 0500-1600
APR 27-APR 30 0500-1600
MAY 04-15 MON-FRI 0500-1600
MAY 18 0500-1600
MAY 20-22 0500-1600
MAY 25 0500-1600
JUN 01-JUL 10 MON-FRI 0500-1600
JUL 13 14 16 17 0500-1600
JUL 20-OCT 23 MON-FRI 0500-1600
OCT 26 27 30 0500-1600
NOV 02- DEC 31 MON-FRI 0500-1600

4. PROCEDURES FOR EXERCISE AIRCRAFT:
A. THE FLIGHTS WILL BE CONDUCTED UNDER VFR CONDITIONS AND UNDER THE
POSITIVE RADAR CONTROL.
B. EXERCISE AIRCRAFT SHALL DISPLAY ANTI/COLLISION AND NAVIGATION
LIGHTS CONTINUOUSLY.

5. PROCEDURES FOR NON-EXERCISE AIRCRAFT:
IN THE INTEREST OF FLYING SAFETY DURING THE EXERCISE NON-EXERCISE
AIRCRAFT ARE STRONGLY ADVISED NOT TO FLY WITHIN THE EXERCISE AREA
DESCRIBED ABOVE.

ESTABLISHED FM GND TO LOWER LIMIT OF AIRSPACE C: 12NM RADIUS
CENTERED ON 480759N 0113353E (10.5NM WSW OTTERSBERG DVOR/DME OTT).
AIRSPACE D (CTR) MUENCHEN (EDDM) AND OBERPFAFFENHOFEN (EDMO) AS WELL
AS THE RESTRICTED AREA EDR MUENCHEN ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE RMZ/TMZ
MUENCHEN. IN THE RMZ/TMZ MUENCHEN ALL VFR FLTS, EXC FOR FLTS BY THE
POLICE FORCES AND ON BEHALF OF THE POLICE, FLTS ON RESCUE AND
DISASTER CONTROL MISSIONS, ACTUAL AMBULANCE FLTS AS WELL AS
MODEL ACFT AND UAS UP TO 120M AGL SHALL USE THE FREQ 135.600MHZ WITH
THE CALL SIGN -POLICE INFO- AND SHALL SQUAWK CODE A6375 WITHOUT
BEING REQ TO DO SO. IF NECESSARY -POLICE INFO- WILL ASSIGN AN
ALTERNATIVE SSR CODE. INSIDE RMZ OBERSCHLEISSHEIM THE FREQ
131.130MHZ SHALL BE USED. BEFORE ENTERING THE RMZ/TMZ, AN INITIAL
CALL CONTAINING THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION SHALL BE MADE:
-DESIGNATOR OF THE STATION BEING CALLED,
-CALL SIGN AND TYPE OF ACFT,
- POSITION, LEVEL AND FLT INTENTIONS.
CONTINUOUS AIR-GROUND VOICE COM WATCH SHALL BE MAINTAINED ON FREQ
135.600MHZ (POLICE INFO) WHILE FLYING WITHIN THE RMZ/TMZ. ACFT SHALL
ALSO REPORT WHEN LEAVING THE RMZ/TMZ. IF THE AERONAUTICAL STATION
CALLED DOES NOT ANSWER, THE FLT THROUGH THE RMZ/TMZ MAY STILL BE
CONTINUED AS LONG AS AIR-GROUND VOICE COM WATCH IS MAINTAINED.
RADIOTELEPHONY REPORTS SHALL STILL BE MADE EVEN IF THE AERONAUTICAL
STATION DOES NOT RESPOND.
THESE REGULATIONS DO NOT APPLY TO IFR FLTS.

RESTRICTIVE MEASURES IN RESPECT OF BELARUS (AMENDMENT 2021/907 ON
JUNE 04 2021).
II.
TILL MAR 11 2026 AT 2359LMT (MAR 11 2026 AT 2259UTC)
FLIGHTS INTO POLISH AIRSPACE, OPERATED BY THE AIR CARRIERS OF THE
REPUBLIC OF BELARUS, ARE BANNED.
III.

RECEIVED AN AUTHORISATION FROM THE COMPETENT AUTHORITIES IN THE
MEMBER STATES TO LAND IN , TAKE OFF FROM OR OVERFLY THE TERRITORY
OF THE EU (E.G. IN THE CASE OF THE HUM STATUS FLIGHTS) AND IN THE
CASE OF AN EMERGENCY LANDING OR AN EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.

EYVN-A7005/25 NOTAM
Q) EYVL / QAFXX / IV / NBO / E / 000/999 / 5545N02228E155
A) EYVL
B) 2025-12-29 13:10 C) 2026-06-01 14:15
E) MILITARY INVASION OF UKRAINE BY RUSSIAN FEDERATION.
LITHUANIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS  OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN
LITHUANIA  SHALL  NOT ENTER  UIR KYIV (UKBU), FIR LVIV (UKLV),
FIR  KYIV (UKBV), FIR  DNIPROPETROVSK (UKDV), FIR   SIMFEROPOL
(UKFV), FIR  ODESA (UKOV), FIR ROSTOV-NA-DONU (URRV).
SAID OPERATORS  AND  AIRCRAFT OWNERS SHALL  ALSO  AVOID FLIGHT
OPERATIONS WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200NM ALONG
THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER.
OPERATIONS WITHIN THE FIR  CHISINAU (LUUU) AIRSPACE SHALL ONLY
BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLI-
CATIONS ISSUED BY REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA.
OPERATORS ARE REMINDED THAT OPERATIONS WITHIN FIR MINSK (UMMV)
ARE  PROHIBITED  IN  ACCORDANCE  WITH  EASA SAFETY  DIRECTIVES
SD-2021-02 AND SD-2021-03.
ADDITIONAL  RISK  ASSESSMENT  AND  FLIGHT  PLANNING  DECISIONS
SHALL BE  TAKEN  BEFORE  OPERATING  IN THE FOLLOWING AIRSPACE:
MOSCOW (UUWV)

AWYS G802 AND Y134 (PANOX-KERMA), N130 (PIVOS-MES), H59 AND Y94

2.- PROCEDURES FOR UNIT CONDUCTING THE ACTIVITIES:
2.1.- FLIGHT PLANS MUST BE SUBMITTED AND PERMISSION BY APPROPRIATE
ATC UNIT MUST BE OBTAINED.
2.2.- OUT OF TMAS, THE LIAISONS OF THE UNIT CONDUCTING THE
ACTIVITIES SHALL ESTABLISH CONTACT WITH ATHINAI CONTROL.

3.1.- IN THE INTEREST OF SAFETY DURING ACTIVITIES, NON EXERCISE ACFT
ARE STRONGLY ADVISED NOT TO FLY WITHIN THE AREA DESIGNATED IN PARA
(1) ABOVE.
3.2- OTHER ACFT UNABLE TO AVOID THE ABOVE DESCRIBED AREA WILL
BE AUTHORIZED TO ENTER THIS AREA AFTER SPECIAL PERMISSION
BY APPROPRIATE ATC UNIT.

LTAA-A5935/25 NOTAM
Q) LTXX / QWELW / IV / BO / W / 000/100 / 4013N02505E026
A) LTBB LGGG
B) 2026-01-02 05:00 C) 2026-12-31 16:00
E) NAVIGATIONAL WARNING TO ALL CONCERNED:

1. TURKIYE REQUESTED THE GREEK AIS TO PROMULGATE APPROPRIATE NOTAM
FOR THE EXERCISE AREA LOCATED WITHIN INTERNATIONAL WATERS AND
AIRSPACE OF AEGEAN SEA REGARDING THE TURKISH NAVY AND AIRFORCE
FIRING MILITARY EXERCISE (ASFAO) TO BE CONDUCTED FROM  02 JAN TILL
31 DEC 2026 0500-1600 UTC(EXCEPT SATURDAYS,SUNDAYS,HOLIDAYS) WITH
REF 250822 LTAAYNYX DEC 2025.
GREEK AIS DID NOT PROMULGATE APPROPRIATE NOTAM FOR THE EXERCISE
AREA IN ACCORDANCE WITH OUR REF 250822 DEC 2025.
UNDER THESE CIRCUMSTANCES DUE TO THE INSISTENT ATTITUDE OF GREECE,
TURKIYE IS LEFT WITH NO OTHER ALTERNATIVE BUT TO TAKE ITS OWN
INITATIVE TO PROMULGATE THE NECESSARY NOTAM FOR THE EXERCISE AREA.
TURKIYE WILL TAKE NECESSARY MEASURES FOR THE SAFETY OF THE GENERAL
AIR TRAFFIC AS SHE DID IN THE PAST AND IS ALWAYS READY FOR
COOPERATION AND COORDINATION IN THIS RESPECT.

2. THE NOTAM INFORMATION FOR THE EXERCISE AREA IS AS FOLLOWED.
TURKISH NAVY AND AIRFORCE SHALL MAKE 'ASFAO' EXERCISE IN
INTERNATIONAL WATERS AND AIRSPACE OF AEGEAN SEA AS DESCRIBED BELOW

3. EXERCISE AREA:
A. LATERAL LIMITS:

AREA: 401630N0253900E 401800N0253000E 403500N0245800E
401100N0243300E 400900N0244500E 402000N0245600E 400700N0253300E
401630N0253900E
B.VERTICAL LIMITS: SFC-10000FT AMSL

C. DATE AND TIMES:
02 JAN 0500-1600
05-30 JAN 0500-1600 EXC SAT SUN

4. PROCEDURES FOR EXERCISE AIRCRAFT:
A. THE FLIGHTS WILL BE CONDUCTED UNDER VFR CONDITIONS AND UNDER THE
POSITIVE RADAR CONTROL.
B. EXERCISE AIRCRAFT SHALL DISPLAY ANTI/COLLISION AND NAVIGATION
LIGHTS CONTINUOUSLY.

5. PROCEDURES FOR NON-EXERCISE AIRCRAFT:
IN THE INTEREST OF FLYING SAFETY DURING THE EXERCISE NON-EXERCISE
AIRCRAFT ARE STRONGLY ADVISED NOT TO FLY WITHIN THE EXERCISE AREA
DESCRIBED ABOVE.

B) 2026-01-15 07:41 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) REF AIP-SPAIN LEBZ AD 2.20 LOCAL REGULATION
ANY REQUEST FOR THE EXTENSION OF CIVIL OPERATION HOURS SHOULD BE
DIRECTED BY COMPANIES OR AIRCRAFT OPERATORS TO THE DELEGATE OF
AENA AT THE TALAVERA LA REAL (BADAJOZ) AIR BASE, AT LEAST FOUR
DAYS IN ADVANCE.

REGULAR AIRLANES THAT OPERATE FROM OR TO BADAJOZ THAT MY
EXPERIENCE DELAYS DUE TO SUPERVENING CAUSES NOT ATTRIBUTABLE TO
OPERATING COMPANIES, MAY SUBMIT A REQUEST FOR THE EXTENSION OF
OPERATING HOURS AT LEAST TWO HOURS IN ADVANCE.

-E-MAIL: PREPARACION(UNDERSCORE)VUELOS(UNDERSCORE)ALA23(AT)EA.MDE.ES
-AFTN: LEBZ
-FAX: +34-924209815

WHEN TRANSPORTING DANGEROUS GOODS, THIS SHALL BE REQUESTED AT LEAST
TWO WORKING DAYS IN ADVANCE.AS A GENERAL RULE,PPR WILL NOT BE
ACCEPTED WITHIN FOLLOWING HOURS:

V: FM FRI 1200 TO MON 0630
I: FM FRI 1330 TO MON 0730

WHEN MILITARY ACTIVITY IS TAKING PLACE, NO CIVIL AIRCRAFT
(IFR/VFR) WILL BE CLEARED FOR PRACTICING APPROACHES OR
TOUCH-AND-GOES.DEPARTURES AND LANDING WILL ONLY BE CLEARED IF A
FLIGHT PLAN WITH DESTINATION LEBZ AD HAS BEEN APPROVED.THESE
OPERATIONS MAY SUFFER DELAYS DUE TO MILITARY ACTIVITY.

DEPARTURES OF CIVIL VFR FLIGHTS WILL ONLY BE CLEARED WHEN NO
MILITARY ACTIVITY IS TAKING PLACE.

ENGING TESTING NOT AVAILABLE ON CIVIL APRON.

    PROVIDIND A LANDING SURFACE 100FT WIDE.
  - ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS,AIRCRAFT REQUIRING 150FT OF RUNWAY
    WIDTH MAY OFFSET 25FT SOUTHEAST OF THE PAINTED CENTERLINE
   (RWY20-LEFT/RWY02-RIGHT).
  - DETERIORATED PAVEMENT ON RUNWAY 02/20 IN WEST ZONE BTN
    DISTANCE MARKERS 5 AND 6 AT 50FT FROM THE CENTERLINE.

LGGG-A4476/25 NOTAM
Q) LGGG / QPFXX / IV / NBO / A / 000/999 / 3755N02356E005
A) LGAV
B) 2025-12-30 13:28 C) 2026-03-31 23:59
E) LOCAL PRE-TRIAL A-CDM OPERATIONAL PROCEDURES ARE IN FORCE AT AP.
-GROUND HANDLER (GH) ARE TO REPORT AND UPDATE TOBT (TARGET OFF-
BLOCK TIME).
-TSAT (TARGET START-UP APPROVAL TIME) WILL BE COMMUNICATED TO
AIRSPACE USER BY GROUND HANDLER (GH).
-WHERE A-VDGS (ADVANCED VISUAL DOCKING GUIDANCE SYSTEM) IS AVAILABLE
TOBT AND TSAT WILL BE DISPLAYED.
-THE PILOT SHALL REQUEST AN UPDATE TO THE TOBT FROM THE GROUND
HANDLER (GH) IF THE TOBT CANNOT BE MET AT ANY MOMENT.
-THE PILOT SHALL ENSURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT WILL BE READY FOR START UP
CLEARANCE AND WILL HAVE CONTACT ON THE DELIVERY FREQUENCY WITHIN THE
TSAT WINDOW (+/-5 MINS).
-DEPARTURE CLEARANCE (EXCEPT SQUAWK) SHALL BE AVAILABLE 18 MINUTES
BEFORE EOBT OR LATER.
- THE PILOT SHALL CONTACT GROUND CONTROL FOR PUSH BACK OR TAXI
WITHIN 5 MIN FROM OBTAINING START UP CLEARANCE (ASAT).
- IF NO PUSH BACK OR TAXI REQUESTED AT ASAT+5, TSAT WILL EXPIRE, AND
A NEW TOBT WILL BE REQUIRED FOR THE FLIGHT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE
DEPARTURE SEQUENCE AND RECEIVE A NEW TSAT.
-PUSH AND HOLD PROCEDURES WILL BE USED TO AVOID HOLDING ARRIVING
AIRCRAFT IN CASE OF OCCUPIED STANDS.

MANAGEMENT(ATFM) PURPOSES.AOBT(ACTUAL OFF BLOCKS TIMES)FOR ALL

1.1.ADS-B DATA REQUIRED FOR OPERATIONS.
1.1.1.FOR ADS-B TESTS USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS
OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S  AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST,WHEN
OPERATING ON THE GROUND:

B)IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE,SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED
MODE A

-AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON ITS STAND.
-WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED,THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY.
1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS
IDENTIFICATION(I.E THE CALL SIGN USED IN FLIGHT),THIS MUST BE
ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL)AT THE TIME OF
THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST.
1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE
AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION.
1.1.4.IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED
ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS),TCAS
SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP,AND
SOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

LGGG-B2268/25 NOTAM

A) LGPZ
B) 2025-12-30 08:34 C) 2026-03-27 23:59
E) ADVANCED ATC TOWER PROCEDURES IN PROGRESS
A-DPI AND C-DPI MESSAGES ARE SENT TO NMOC AND BE USED FOR AIR
TRAFFIC FLOW MANAGEMENT (ATFM) PURPOSES AOBT (ACTUAL OFF BLOCKS
TIMES) FOR ALL DEPARTING IFR FLIGHTS
1.1 ADS-B DATA REQUIRED FOR OPERATIONS
1.1.1 FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL,
PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY
MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND:
A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR
B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE
ASSIGNED MODE A
-FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK
-AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND
-WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY.
1.1.2 WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING
ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E THE CALL SIGN USED IN FLIGHT)
THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR
TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST
1.1.3 THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE
AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION.
1.1.4.IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS
BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND
SSR RADARS) TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING
CLEARANCE TO LINE UP AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED
AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

MESSAGES ARE SENT TO NMOC AND ARE USED FOR AIR TRAFFIC FLOW
MANAGEMENT(ATFM) PURPOSES.AOBT(ACTUAL OFF BLOCKS TIMES)FOR ALL
DEPARTING IFR FLIGHTS.
1.1.ADS-B DATA REQUIRED FOR OPERATIONS.
1.1.1.FOR ADS-B TESTS USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS
OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S  AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST,WHEN
OPERATING ON THE GROUND:
A)SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A,OR
B)IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE,SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED
MODE A
-FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK.
-AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON ITS STAND.
-WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED,THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY.
1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS
IDENTIFICATION(I.E THE CALL SIGN USED IN FLIGHT),THIS MUST BE
ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL)AT THE TIME OF
THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST.
1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE
AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION.
1.1.4.IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED
ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS),TCAS
SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP,AND
SOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

LIIA-B3955/25 NOTAM
Q) LIBB / QFAXX / IV / NBO / A / 000/999 / 4107N01645E005
A) LIBD
B) 2025-07-14 18:09 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'  PROVISIONS FOR GENERAL AVIATION
AIRCRAFT, CHANGE AS FOLLOWS:
ALL GENERAL AVIATION, AERIAL WORK, AND AIR TAXI FLIGHTS OPERATING
WITH AIRCRAFT HAVING A CAPACITY OF 19 SEATS OR LESS, ARE SUBJECT TO
A MANDATORY PRIOR PERMISSION REQUIRED (PPR) AUTHORIZATION FROM THE
AIRPORT OPERATOR. THE PPR MUST BE REQUESTED THROUGH THE SELECTED
GROUND HANDLER. THE PPR CODE, ASSIGNED BY THE AIRPORT OPERATOR UPON
FAVORABLE EVALUATION OF THE REQUEST, MUST BE OBTAINED PRIOR TO
DEPARTURE OF THE FLIGHTS BOUND TO LIBD. THE NAME OF THE SELECTED
GROUND HANDLER AND THE ASSIGNED PPR CODE MUST BE MANDATORILY ENTERED
IN FIELD 18 OF THE FLIGHT PLAN (FPL).
THE GENERAL AVIATION HANDLERS PRESENT AT LIBD ARE:
A.    DELTA AEROTAXI DUTY HOURS: 0700-1900 (0600-1800), H24 O/R BY
TEL: +39 080 5371603,
MOBILE: +39 331 1779237 FAX: +39 080 5340345
WEB: WWW.DELTAFLR.IT , E-MAIL: BARI(A)DELTAFLR.IT
B.    SKY SERVICES DUTY HOURS: 0700-1900 (0600-1800), H24 O/R BY
TEL: +39 080 5311719,
MOBILE: +39 366 7214138 FAX: +39 080 5316354
WEB: WWW.SKYSERVICES.IT, E-MAIL: BRI(A)SKYSERVICES.IT
C.    FLY SERVICES DUTY HOURS: 0700-1900 (0600-1800), H24 O/R BY
MOBILE: +39 345 7066603 AND +39 340 2447592
WEB: WWW.FLYSERVICE.EU,  E-MAIL: BRIFBO(A)FLYSERVICE.EU
-AEROPORTI DI PUGLIA, USING A DEDICATED SOFTWARE APPLICATION, REVIEWS
PPR REQUESTS BASED ON THE CAPACITY PARAMETERS ESTABLISHED FOR BARI
AIRPORT, AS OUTLINED IN THE AIRPORT REGULATIONS.
DURING THE PERIOD BETWEEN APRIL 1ST AND OCTOBER 1ST OF EACH YEAR,
THE FOLLOWING LIMITATIONS APPLY:
MAXIMUM 24 HOUR PARKING - THE NUMBER OF AIRCRAFTS THAT MAY PARK ON
THE APRON ARE:
- 2 STANDS CATEGORY A
- 2 STANDS CATEGORY B
- 2 STANDS CATEGORY C
MAXIMUM 5-DAY PARKING - THE NUMBER OF AIRCRAFTS THAT MAY PARK ON THE
APRON ARE (EXCLUDING FERRY-IN FLIGHTS):
- 1 STAND CATEGORY A
- 1 STAND CATEGORY B
- 1 STAND CATEGORY C
THE AIRCRAFT OPERATOR MUST SELECT A DESIGNATED GROUND HANDLER, WHO
WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR FINALIZING THE PPR REQUEST BY ENTERING THE
FOLLOWING FLIGHT DETAILS INTO THE AFOREMENTIONED SOFTWARE
APPLICATION:
- CALLSIGN
- ESTIMATED DATE AND TIME OF ARRIVAL
- ESTIMATED DATE AND TIME OF DEPARTURE
- AIRCRAFT TYPE (INCLUDING WINGSPAN, LENGTH, AND REGISTRATION
DETAILS)
- ROUTING
- FLIGHT TYPE (E.G. PRIVATE, COMMERCIAL, ETC.)
- NUMBER OF PASSENGERS ON BOARD
THE PPR REQUEST MUST BE SUBMITTED TO 'AEROPORTI DI PUGLIA'  DURING
HR 0800-1600 (0700-1500) STARTING FROM THE TENTH DAY PRIOR TO THE
AIRCRAFTS ARRIVAL DATE AND NO LATER THAN 3 HOURS BEFORE THE
AIRCRAFTS ARRIVAL.
STATE/MILITARY AIRCRAFT, AIR AMBULANCE FLIGHTS, HUMANITARIAN,
RESCUE, AND EMERGENCY FLIGHTS ARE NOT SUBJECT TO THIS REGULATION.
EXEMPTIONS ALSO APPLY TO FLIGHTS WITH HANGAR PARKING AND THOSE
PARKED ON THE AEROCLUB APRON, AS SPECIFIED IN THE AIRPORT
REGULATIONS.
-OTHER DATA UNCHANGED
REF AIP AD 2 LIBD 1-13  ITEM 2.20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'
POINT 7.1

LIIA-B5053/25 NOTAM
Q) LIBB / QFAXX / IV / NBO / A / 000/999 / 4107N01645E005
A) LIBD
B) 2025-09-14 22:01 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) RADIO FAILURE ON MANOUVERING AREA CHANGE AS FOLLOW:
DEPARTING AIRCRAFT:
SHALL CONTINUE ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE TILL THEIR CLEARANCE
LIMIT RECEIVED WAITING FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VEHICLE
IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED BACK TO THE STAND
ARRIVING AIRCRAFT:
A) IF THE RADIO FAILURE OCCURS WHEN THE AIRCRAFT HAS ALREADY
RECEIVED TAXI INSTRUCTION SHALL CONTINUE TO THE LIMIT CLEARANCE
ASSIGNED WHERE WILL WAIT FOR FOLLOW ME VEHICLE OR,
IF AUTHORIZED, TO THE STAND ASSIGNED.
B) IF THE RADIO FAILURE OCCURS EN ROUTE OR ANY TAXI INSTRUCTION
HAS BEEN RECEIVED, THE AIRCRAFT SHALL COMPLY WITH THE FOLLOWING:
- RUNWAY 25 IN USE
IF ANY TAXI INSTRUCTION HAS BEEN RECEIVED, THE AIRCRAFT
WILL VACATE THE RUNWAY THROUGH TWY G EXCEEDED THE WAITING
POINT WILL STOP TAXIING NEAR IHP (INTERMEDIATE HOLDING POSITION)
WAITING FOR FOLLOW ME VEHICLE
- RUNWAY 07 IN USE
IF ANY TAXI INSTRUCTION HAS BEEN RECEIVED, THE AIRCRAFT
WILL VACATE THE RUNWAY THROUGH TWY  A, EXCEEDED THE WAITING
POINT, WILL STOP TAXIING NEAR IHP (INTERMEDIATE HOLDING POSITION)
T1 WAITING FOR FOLLOW ME VEHICLE
REF AIP AD 2 LIBD 1-16

LIIA-B5463/25 NOTAM
Q) LIBB / QFAXX / IV / NBO / A / 000/999 / 4125N01531E005
A) LIBF
B) 2025-10-01 22:01 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) 4.7 'RADIO FAILURE ON THE MANOUVERING AREA'
- POINT 8 'RADIO FAILURE ON MANOUVERING AREA' CHANGE AS FOLLOW:
WHENEVER AN AIRCRAFT OPERATING IN MANOUVERING AREA EXPERIENCES A
RADIO FAILURE THE FOLLOWING ACTIONS MUST BE OBSERVED:
- DEPARTING AIRCRAFT:
THE AIRCRAFT SHALL CONTINUE TO THE LAST COORDINATED POINT,
WAITING FOR THE FOLLOW-ME TO RETURN TO THE PARKING STAND.
- ARRIVING AIRCRAFT:
IF AT THE TIME OF THE FAILURE A TAXI ROUTE HAVE ALREADY BEEN
COORDINATED, THE AIRCRAFT SHALL STRICTLY CONTINUE ON THE LAST
COORDINATED ROUTE AND IT WILL WAIT FOR THE FOLLOW-ME CAR TO RETURN
TO PARKING STAND.
IF THE PARKING STAND IS PROVIDED IT WILL TAXI TO THE STAND.
IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IF NO TAXI ROUTE HAVE ALREADY
BEEN COORDINATED, THE AIRCRAFT SHALL STOP ON THE RUNWAY AND
WAIT FOR THE FOLLOW-ME CAR TO REACH THE PARKING STAND:
- WHEN LANDING RWY33, THE AIRCRAFT SHALL STOPS IN THE PROXIMITY OF
TWY 'B'
- WHEN LANDING RWY15, THE AIRCRAFT SHALL STOPS IN THE PROXIMITY OF
TWY 'A'
REF AIP AD 2 LIBF 1-14

LIIA-B5461/25 NOTAM
Q) LIBB / QFAXX / IV / NBO / A / 000/999 / 4125N01531E005
A) LIBF
B) 2025-10-01 22:01 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) 4 'AIRCRAFT PROCEDURES IN REDUCED VISIBILITY CONDITIONS (AWO)'
CHANGE AS FOLLOW:
- 4.1 AERODROME OPERATING MINIMA
THE AIRPORT OPERATING MINIMA ARE REPORTED BELOW. THESE MINIMA DO NOT
APPLY TO MILITARY, PUBLIC SECURITY, CUSTOMS FIRE FIGHTING, SAR AND
HEMS/EMS AIRCRAFT OPERATING IN ACCORDANCE WITH RELEVANT OPERATIONAL
REGULATION.
- TAKE-OFF FROM BOTH RUNWAY: VISIBILITY NOT LESS THAN 800M
- LANDING FROM BOTH RUNWAY: VISIBILITY NOT LESS THAN 1500M
- 4.2 AIRPORT PROCEDURE IN REDUCED VISIBILITY CONDITIONS (RAVP)
REDUCED VISIBILITY PROCEDURES APPLY WHENEVER CONDITIONS ARE SUCH
THAT ALL PART OF THE MOUVEMENT AREA CANNOT BE VISUALLY MONITORED BY
ATS PERSONNEL. A REDUCTION IN AIRPORT CAPACITY IS TO BE EXPECTED DUE
TO INCREASED SPACING BETWEEN SUCCESSIVE ARRIVING AIRCRAFT AND
RESTRICTIONS APPLIED TO GROUND MOVEMENT.
4.2.1 VISIBILITY CONDITIONS 2 (PART OF THE MOVEMENT AREA CANNOT BE
VISUALLY MONITORED BY ATS PERSONNEL)
THE SIMULTANEOUS PRESENCE OF MORE THAN ONE AIRCRAFT IS NOT PERMITTED
IN PORTION OF THE MANOEUVRING AREA NOT VISIBLE TO ATS PERSONNEL.
4.2.2 VISIBILITY CONDITION 3 (VIS LESS THAN 400M)
THE SIMULTANEOUS PRESENCE OF MORE THAN ONE AIRCRAFT IS NOT PERMITTED
IN THE MANOEUVRING AREA. FOLLOW-ME MANDATORY FOR TAXIING.
4.2.3 VISIBILITY CONDITION 4 ( VIS LESS OR EQUAL 75M)
VISIBILITY CONDITIONS 3 PROCEDURES ARE APPLIED.
- 4.3 TRAINING ACTIVITIES
NOT ALLOWED DURING RAVP
- 4.4 GROUND MOVEMENT
WITH RVR/VISIBILITY LESS THAN 400M AIRCRAFT MOVEMENT IS ALLOWED ONLY
WITH
FOLLOW-ME OPERATIONS
- 4.5 CONTINGENCY
NIL
- 4.6 RADIO FAILURE ON THE MANOUEVRING AREA
SEE TABLE 20.8
REF AIP AD 2 LIBF 1-13

LIIA-A5196/25 NOTAM
Q) LIBB / QFAXX / IV / NBO / A / 000/999 / 4039N01756E005
A) LIBR
B) 2025-09-29 21:59 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS ITEM 4 'AERODROME PROCEDURES IN
REDUCED VISIBILITY CONDITIONS (AWO)' CHG AS FLW:
ITEM 4
AIRPORT PROCEDURES IN REDUCED VISIBILITY CONDITIONS (RAVP)
WHEN ALL OR PART OF THE MANOEUVRING AREA IS NOT VISIBLE FROM THE
TWR, THE FOLLOWING PROCEDURES ARE APPLIED TO ENSURE THE SAFETY
OF AIRCRAFT OPERATIONS. UNDER SUCH CONDITIONS, A REDUCTION IN
AIRPORT CAPACITY IS TO BE EXPECTED DUE TO THE RESTRICTIONS APPLIED
TO GROUND MOVEMENTS.
4.1 AERODROME OPERATING MINIMA
FOR BOTH RUNWAYS 13/31 LANDING AND TAKE-OFF OPERATIONS ARE PERMITTED
WITH RVR EQUAL TO OR GREATER THAN 550 METERS. IF RVR IS NOT
AVAILABLE, OPERATIONS ARE PERMITTED WITH VISIBILITY EQUAL TO OR
GREATER THAN 550 METERS.
RMK: WITH RVR LESS THAN 550M AIRCRAFT READY OPERATIONS WILL BE
SUSPENDED
4.1.1 OPERATIONAL TAXIING MINIMA
FOLLOW-ME IS MANDATORY WHNE RVR/VIS LESS THEN 400M.
GROUND MOVEMENT PHROIBITED WHEN RVR LESS THEN 75M
4.1.2 GROUND MOVEMENT
IN THE PORTION OF THE MANOEUVRING AREA NOT VISIBLE FROM THE TWR,
AIRCRAFT MOVEMENT WILL BE RESTRICTED/LIMITED TO ONE AIRCRAFT AT
A TIME.
4.2 TRAINING ACTIVITIES
STARTING FROM RVR VALUE EQUAL TO OR LESS THAN 1500M AND/OR IN
CONDITIONS OF REDUCED VISIBILITY, THE TRAINING FLIGHT ACTIVITY IS
SUSPENDED.
REF AIP AD 2 LIBR 1-16 (ITEM 2-20 LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS)

FOR ARRIVING ACFT:
1. IF AT THE MOMENT OF THE FAILURE TAX INSTRUCTIONS HAVE ALREADY
BEEN RECEIVED, ARR ACFT SHALL STRICTLY FOLLOW THE AUTHORIZED ROUTING
TO REACH THE ASSIGNED ACFT STAND, OR PROCEED UP TO THE LIMIT OF THE
CLEARANCE AND THERE STOP WAITING FOR THE FOLLOW-ME TO BE GUIDED
TO THE ACFT STAND.
2. IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IF NO TAX INSTRUCTIONS HAVE
BEEN RECEIVED, ARR ACFT SHALL VACATE THE RWY AS BELOW INDICATED AND
STOP WAITING FOR THE FOLLOW-ME TO BE GUIDED TO THE STAND:
- LDG RWY25: VACATE RWY VIA TWY 'E' THEN PROCEED ON TWY 'T' AND
STOP AT RWY HLDG PSN 'T' BFR INTERSECTION WITH RWY 02/20

STOP AT INTERMEDIATE HLDG PSN BFR INTERSECTION WITH TWY 'J'
- LDG RWY20: VACATE RWY VIA TWY 'G' THEN PROCEED ON TWY 'S' AND

LIIA-B5113/25 NOTAM
Q) LIBB / QFAXX / IV / NBO / A / 000/999 / 4030N01723E005
A) LIBG
B) 2025-09-12 14:47 C) 2038-01-19 03:14
E) RADIO FAILURE ON MANOEUVRING AREA CHANGE TO READ:
WHENEVER AN AIRCRAFT OPERATING ON THE MANOEUVRING AREA EXPERIENCES
RADIO FAILURE, THE FOLLOWING MUST BE OBSERVED:
DEPARTING AIRCRAFT:
THE AIRCRAFT SHALL STRICTLY CONTINUE ON THE ASSIGNED ROUTE UP TO THE
LIMIT OF THE CLEARANCE RECEIVED, WAITING FOR THE FOLLOW-ME TO RETURN
TO THE PARKING STAND.
ARRIVING AIRCRAFT:
IF, AT THE TIME OF THE FAILURE, TAXI INSTRUCTIONS HAVE ALREADY BEEN
RECEIVED, THE AIRCRAFT SHALL STRICTLY CONTINUE ON THE ASSIGNED ROUTE
UP TO THE LIMIT OF THE CLEARANCE RECEIVED, WHERE IT WILL WAIT FOR THE
FOLLOW-ME FOR PARKING.
IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IF NO TAXI INSTRUCTIONS HAVE BEEN
RECEIVED:
- IF SPECIFIC INSTRUCTION IS RECEIVED BY LIGHT SIGNALS, VACATE THE
LANDING AREA AND WAIT FOR THE FOLLOW-ME FOR SUBSEQUENT TAXI TO
PARKING.
- IF SUCH INSTRUCTIONS ARE NOT RECEIVED BY LIGHT SIGNALS, STOP ON
THE RUNWAY AND WAIT FOR THE FOLLOW-ME TO REACH THE PARKING STAND:
 WHEN LANDING ON RWY 35, THE AIRCRAFT STOPS NEAR TWY N.
 WHEN LANDING ON RWY 17, AFTER BACKTRACK IF IT IS REQUIRED, THE
AIRCRAFT STOPS NEAR TWY A.
REF AIP AD2 LIBG 1-11 ITEM 2-20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'

FOR ARRIVING ACFT:
1. IF AT THE MOMENT OF THE FAILURE TAX INSTRUCTIONS HAVE ALREADY
BEEN RECEIVED, ARR ACFT SHALL STRICTLY FOLLOW THE AUTHORIZED ROUTING
TO REACH THE ASSIGNED ACFT STAND, OR PROCEED UP TO THE LIMIT OF THE
CLEARANCE AND THERE STOP WAITING FOR THE FOLLOW-ME TO BE GUIDED
TO THE ACFT STAND.

BEEN RECEIVED, ARR ACFT SHALL VACATE THE RWY AS BELOW INDICATED AND
STOP WAITING FOR THE FOLLOW-ME TO BE GUIDED TO THE STAND:
- LDG RWY25: VACATE RWY VIA TWY 'E' THEN PROCEED ON TWY 'T' AND
STOP AT RWY HLDG PSN 'T' BFR INTERSECTION WITH RWY 02/20
- LDG RWY07: VACATE RWY VIA TWY 'A' THEN PROCEED ON TWY 'T' AND
STOP AT INTERMEDIATE HLDG PSN BFR INTERSECTION WITH TWY 'J'
- LDG RWY20: VACATE RWY VIA TWY 'G' THEN PROCEED ON TWY 'S' AND
STOP AT RWY HLDG PSN 'S' BFR INTERSECTION WITH RWY 07/25.

ENTRO 562M DALLA TESTATA PISTA A CAUSA DELLA PRESENZA DI OSTACOLI,

RWY20L: TORA 562M TODA 562M ASDA 805M LDA 557M.
(REF AIP AD 2 LILV  1-5 ITEM 2.12 'CARATTERISTICHE
FISICHE DELLE PISTE' E ITEM 2.13 'DISTANZE DICHIARATE')
L'USO SIMULTANEO DELLA NUOVA RWY 02R/20L E DELLA RWY 02L/20R IN ERBA
E' PROIBITO, PRIMA DI OPERARE SU UNA RWY, I PILOTI DEVONO ASSICURARSI
CHE NON SIANO IN CORSO OPERAZIONI DI VOLO SULLA RWY PARALLELA.
PER LA NUOVA RWY 02R/20L IN ASFALTO, LE REGOLAZIONI APPLICABILI CON
RIFERIMENTO A 'USO PREFERENZIALE DELLE PISTE' E 'PROCEDURE
ANTIRUMORE' SONO LE STESSE PUBBLICATE IN AIP PER LA RWY 02L/20R IN
ERBA
(REF AIP AD 2 LILV 1-8 ITEM 2.20 'REGOLAMENTI LOCALI DI AEROPORTO'
E ITEM 2.21 'PROCEDURE ANTIRUMORE')
ENGLISH TEXT:
1. GRASS RWY 02/20 IS RENAMED  02L/20R
2. NEW RWY 02R/20L INSTALLED IN PLACE OF FORMER ASPHALT TWY WITH FLW
PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS AND LIMITATIONS:
-DIMENSIONS: 805M X 14M
-RWY02R: ACFT SHALL TKOF WI 557M FM RWY HEAD DUE TO PRESENCE
OF OBSTACLES, THE LAST 248M USABLE FOR LDG ARE AVBL AS SWY
IN CASE OF ABORTED TKOF. THR02R IS DISPLACED 243M, CWY NIL
RWY20L: ACFT SHALL TKOF WI 562M FM RWY HEAD DUE TO PRESENCE OF
OBSTACLES, THE LAST 243M, USABLE FOR LDG, ARE AVBL AS SWY
IN CASE OF ABORTED TKOF. THR 20L DISPLACED 248M, CWY NIL.
AS A CONSEQUENCE, DECLARED DISTANCES ARE TO BE CONSIDERED AS FLW:
RWY02R: TORA 557M TODA 557M ASDA 805M LDA 562M
RWY20L: TORA 562M TODA 562M ASDA 805M LDA 557M.
(REF AIP AD 2 LILV 1-5 ITEM 2.12 'RWY PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS',
AND ITEM 2.13 'DECLARED DISTANCES')
SIMULTANEOUS USE OF NEW RWY 02R/20L AND GRASS RWY 02L/20R
IS FORBIDDEN, BEFORE OPERATING ON A RWY PILOTS SHALL ENSURE
THAT NO OTHER TFC IS PERFORMING FLT OPERATIONS ON THE PARALLEL RWY.
FOR NEW ASPHALT RWY 02R/20L, APPLICABLE REGULATIONS REFERRED TO
'RUNWAY PREFERENTIAL USE' AND 'NOISE ABATEMENT PROCEDURES'
ARE THOSE PUBLISHED IN AIP FOR GRASS RWY 02L/20R RESPECTIVELY.
(REF AIP AD 2 LILV 1-8 ITEM 2.20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'
AND ITEM 2.21 'NOISE ABATEMENT PROCEDURE'

E) OPERATIONAL TRIAL CRITERIA FOR RUNWAY SELECTION AND THEIR USE.
IN ORDER TO CHANGE THE RUNWAY CONFIGURATION FROM THE PREFERENTIAL
ONE, ATC WILL CONSIDER THE FOLLOWING ITEMS:
- RWY AND TWY AVAILABILITY,
- INSTRUMENT APPROACH PROCEDURES AND AVAILABILITY OF APPROACH AND
LANDING AIDS,
- SIGNIFICANT METEOROLOGICAL CONDITIONS (SURFACE TAILWIND COMPONENT
EXCEEDING 8 KNOTS OF STEADY WIND FOR AT LEAST 10 MINUTES EXCLUDING
GUSTS, SURFACE CROSSWIND COMPONENT EXCEEDING 30 KNOTS, EXCLUDING
GUSTS, WINDSHEAR REPORTED OR FORECAST, THUNDERSTORMS THAT MAY
AFFECT THE APPROACH OR DEPARTURE PHASES, WET RUNWAY CONDITIONS
OR POOR BRAKING ACTION)
- THE SURFACE WIND COMPONENTS ARE NOT TO BE INTENDED AS OPERATIONAL
LIMITS, BUT RATHER AS GUIDELINES FOR ATC RUNWAY SELECTION
- THE RUNWAY CONFIGURATION IN USE 34R MAY BE CHANGED TO CONFIGURATION
16L WHEN THE SURFACE WIND COMPONENT FROM THE NORTHERN QUADRANTS IS
FOR AT LEAST 10 MINUTES  STEADILY BELOW 8 KNOTS.
- IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT WHILE THE TWR PREPARES THE NEW RUNWAY
CONFIGURATION BASED ON THE CONDITIONS, THE ACTUAL CHANGE OF
CONFIGURATION MAY TAKE PLACE LATER, WHEN CURRENT TRAFFIC CONDITIONS
PERMIT.

E) ADVANCED TWR PROCEDURES IN FORCE:
   DUE TO THE START OF INFORMATION EXCHANGE FOR DEPARTURE
   FLIGHTS USING EUROPEAN STANDARD FOR A-CDM AIRPORTS, LROP
   WILL SEND A-DPI MESSAGES TO NMOC REPORTING TTOT IN ORDER
   TO IMPROVE TAKE-OFF TIME ESTIMATES.
   THE FPL OF ACFT THAT FOR ANY REASON RETURNS TO STAND AFTER
   EOBT WILL BE SUSPENDED IN THE ATM NETWORK WITH A C-DPI
   MESSAGE. THE AIRCRAFT OPERATOR WILL RECEIVE A FLS MESSAGE
   WITH REASON-SUSPENDED BY DEPARTURE AIRPORT- TO REVOKE THE
   SUSPENSION, OPERATORS SHALL UPDATE EOBT WITH A DLA OR CHG
   MESSAGE.
   ACRONYMS:
   A-CDM (AIRPORT COLLABORATIVE DECISION MAKING)
   A-DPI (ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION)
   ATFCM (AIR TRAFFIC FLOW CAPACITY MANAGEMENT)
   C-DPI (CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION)
   FLS   (FLIGHT SUSPENSION)
   NMOC  (NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER)
   TTOT  (TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME)

E) ADVANCED TWR PROCEDURES IN FORCE:
   DUE TO THE START OF INFORMATION EXCHANGE FOR DEPARTURE
   FLIGHTS USING EUROPEAN STANDARD FOR A-CDM AIRPORTS, LROP
   WILL SEND A-DPI MESSAGES TO NMOC REPORTING TTOT IN ORDER
   TO IMPROVE TAKE-OFF TIME ESTIMATES.
   THE FPL OF ACFT THAT FOR ANY REASON RETURNS TO STAND AFTER
   EOBT WILL BE SUSPENDED IN THE ATM NETWORK WITH A C-DPI
   MESSAGE. THE AIRCRAFT OPERATOR WILL RECEIVE A FLS MESSAGE
   WITH REASON-SUSPENDED BY DEPARTURE AIRPORT- TO REVOKE THE
   SUSPENSION, OPERATORS SHALL UPDATE EOBT WITH A DLA OR CHG
   MESSAGE.
   ACRONYMS:
   A-CDM (AIRPORT COLLABORATIVE DECISION MAKING)
   A-DPI (ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION)
   ATFCM (AIR TRAFFIC FLOW CAPACITY MANAGEMENT)
   C-DPI (CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION)
   FLS   (FLIGHT SUSPENSION)
   NMOC  (NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER)
   TTOT  (TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME)
